app

Class ContentPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • app.ContentPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class ContentPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

    ContentPanel class

    ContentPanel is responsible for creating GUI of the central pane of application.
    Central pane consists of managing tools for calculations, bar chart and table.

    Creating a window and GUI take place in constructor of ContentPanel class. Class is supported by events, which are triggered by user activity.

    Since:
    2019-05-16
    Version:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Paweł Szeląg
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContentPanel

        public ContentPanel(FileHelper helper,
                    StatusBar state,
                    java.awt.FileDialog saveDialog,
                    java.awt.FileDialog openDialog,
                    MainWindow frame)
        Constructor of the ContentPanel class.
        Responsible for creating a graphic user interface, assigning a data model
        and handling events triggered by user.
        Parameters:
        helper - An FileHelper object. Responsible for storing and managing informations about active file.
        state - StatusBar object instance. Responsible for containing informations about current file name and save status.
        saveDialog - Save dialog window instance object.
        openDialog - Load dialog window instance object.
        frame - MainWindow frame object handler.
